member.name: T:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.DecoratingTraceListener
member.summary: A trace listener decorator to be used as a base class.
member.devdoc: We don't override everything virtual in TraceListener, but rather only the members that are used in the Tracer and are potentially useful (i.e. ). The Write overloads in particular all end up calling the two abstract Write/WriteLine in the base TraceListener, so that's the only thing we forward, since it's a required contract that we don't want to repeat in each specific decorator.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.DecoratingTraceListener.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.TraceListener)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The inner listener to perform tracing through.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.DecoratingTraceListener.InnerListener
member.summary: Gets the inner listener specified in the constructor.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.SystemTraceListener
member.summary: A trace listener decorator that filters out trace events with messages starting with .

member.name: M:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.SystemTraceListener.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.TraceListener)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The inner listener to perform tracing through.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.SystemTraceListener.TraceEvent(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Traces the event if it's not a user trace event.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.SystemTraceListener.TraceEvent(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Traces the event if it's not a user trace event.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.DefaultHandler`1
member.summary: Provides a default (empty) implementation for request handlers It's useful for components that need to listen messages and execute some logic when the handler is executed by subscribing to the Handled event

member.name: T:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.Serialization.VersionJsonConverter
member.summary:
If this converter is not used then new Version(1,1) does not work because by default the serializer will try to create a Version instance using the -1 value for the Revision and Build parts and it's not valid.
So we need to serialize and deserialize only the values that have been set (!= -1) and ignore the others (== -1).

member.name: F:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.TracingConfiguration.traceLogFileNameTemplate
member.summary: {0} = Date and time suffix {1} = Parent process id (VS' by default, or the current process ID if not provided) {2} = Agent name

member.name: M:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.TracingConfiguration.Setup(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets up the tracing for a console-based agent.
member.param: Whether to delete old log files. This is only set to true on the Broker, so that there is no contention trying to delete the files.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Messaging.Client.MessageHandlerManager.NotifyHandlerExecutionStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets if the HandlerExecutionStatusMessage should be send before and after executing the handlers
